ProblemStudent.description: Grades measure outcomes, not effort. Real learning momentum stays hidden — from you, your teachers, and everyone else.

problems.title: Effort stays invisible
problems.body: You work hard — but nothing shows it. No way to see or share your real progress beyond a score on a page.

problems.title: Grades flatten reality
problems.body: One bad week can erase months of growth. A single number can't capture a trajectory or reflect real momentum.

problems.title: Motivation loses direction
problems.body: When progress isn't visible, it's hard to know if you're improving — or why pushing harder even matters.

ProblemInstitution.description: The gap between how students experience learning and how institutions measure it — that's where disengagement hides.

problems.title: Grades miss the picture
problems.body: Schools track scores, not learning behavior. Disengagement builds silently — invisible until it's too late to act.

problems.title: Signals arrive too late
problems.body: By the time grades drop, intervention windows have passed. The warning was always there — just unreadable.

problems.title: Data exists. Insight doesn't.
problems.body: Academic systems collect mountains of data but surface no engagement signal. Numbers sit idle, decisions stay guesswork.

SolutionStudent.description: EduReview builds a real-time picture of your learning momentum — tracking the behaviors that actually drive progress, not just the score at the end of the semester.

FAQInstitution.headline: Frequently asked questions
FAQInstitution.subtitle: Everything you need to know before applying for the pilot.

items.q: What data does EduReview actually use?
a: Assignment submission timing and completion rates
No new data collection — only what your school already produces

items.q: Does this require any teacher input or extra workload?
items.a: No. EduReview reads existing academic data automatically. Teachers do not need to change any workflows, learn new tools, or enter additional information.

items.q: How does the pilot programme work?
items.a: We onboard your institution, connect to your data source (CSV import to start, full integration later), and deliver a working engagement dashboard within two weeks. The pilot runs for one semester with full support from our team.

items.q: How is student data handled and kept private?
items.a: Student data is stored securely and never sold or shared with third parties. Individual scores are only visible to authorised institution staff. All data handling complies with applicable data protection regulations.

items.q: Which systems do you currently integrate with?
items.a: We currently support manual and CSV-based data import. Native integration with Kundelik is in active development and will be available in the next phase.

items.q: Is there a cost to join the pilot?
items.a: The pilot programme is free for the initial semester. We are focused on validating the product with a small number of institutions before moving to a paid model.

FAQStudent.headline: Frequently asked questions
FAQStudent.subtitle: Everything you need to know before joining the waitlist.

items.q: What does the Engagement Score actually measure?
a: Assignment completion rate and submission timing
Grade improvement relative to your own personal baseline
Overall learning momentum across the semester

items.q: Can my teachers or school see my score?
items.a: Your Engagement Score is personal by default. Aggregated, anonymised data may be visible to your institution, but your individual score and details are yours alone unless you choose to share them.

items.q: When will I get access to the platform?
items.a: We are rolling out access school by school. Join the waitlist and we will notify you as soon as your school is on board. Priority access goes to students who sign up early.

items.q: Is this just another grade tracker?
items.a: No. EduReview does not track grades — it tracks learning behavior. We measure the patterns that predict growth: consistency, effort, improvement trend. Your score can rise even when a single grade stays flat.
Yes. EduReview is free for students, always. The platform is funded through institutional partnerships, so you never pay.
